title: COMMANDO: ON THE FRONT LINE  (2007) -- Royal Marine Commando
description:
"FROM CIVVIE STREET TO THE BATTLEFIELD"


"COMMANDO: ON THE FRONT LINE" (2007) 
User Rating:
9.2/10  <---
Director: Christopher Terrill
Writer: Christopher Terrill

20 September 2007 (UK)

Genre: Documentary
 
Running Time: 256 minutes approx.

Audio: DOLBY STEREO

Aspect Ratio: 16x9

REGION CODE: 2 <<---

Subtitles: ENGLISH


DISK 1 of 2-set series  <<---


"From civilian life to the front line of war, join acclaimed film maker CHRIS 

TERRILL (HMS Brilliant, Shipmates) as he follows a group of young recruits, each 

embarking on an extraordinary, intense and life-changing journey to become a 

Royal Marine Commando.

With unprecedented access to both the training and battleground, this series, 

first seen on ITV 1, captures the exhilaration, excitement and fear of 924 Troop 

as they prepare for the killing fields of Afghanistan.

Terrill, who himself lived and trained with the rookie Marines of 924 Troop, 

records eight months of training that will test nerve, stamina and intelligence 

-- and then shows firsthand how the most grueling military training in the world 

is put into practice on the battlefields of Afghanistan."


PLEASE TAKE NOTE OF THE IMDB rating: 9.2 / 10   You don't see that high a rating often. This is a helluva documentary.
